data.title: An Ideal husband | Oliver Parker | 1999 | ACMI collection
data.meta_description: Romantic comedy set in London during the late 1800’s inspired by Oscar Wilde’s play. Rupert Everett plays Arthur Goring, an upper class, womanisin..
data.text:
Romantic comedy set in London during the late 1800’s inspired by Oscar Wilde’s play. Rupert Everett plays Arthur Goring, an upper class, womanising bachelor famed for his idleness and wit. His best friend Sir Robert Chiltern (Jeremy Northam) is a respected politician with a captivating and righteous wife (Cate Blanchett). Arthur’s loyalty and friendship is put to the test when the foundation of his friend’s idyllic marriage is threatened by the arrival of the scheming Mrs Cheveley (Julianne Moore) carrying secrets from Sir Robert’s past. Arthur finds himself caught up in a web of love, betrayal and deceit as he attempts to console his friends and protect their marriage. His actions inadvertently lead to changes in his own life and future. Also stars Minnie Driver and John Wood. Screenplay by Oliver Parker. Photography by David Johnson. Edited by Guy Bensley. Music composed by Charlie Mole.

Our collection comprises over 40,000 moving image works, acquired and catalogued between the 1940s and early 2000s. As a result, some items may reflect outdated, offensive and possibly harmful views and opinions. ACMI is working to identify and redress such usages.

Learn more about our collection and our collection policy here. If you come across harmful content on our website that you would like to report, let us know.

Please note: this archive is an ongoing body of work. Sometimes the credit information (director, year etc) isn’t available so these fields may be left blank; we are progressively filling these in with further research.
